hackathon-description-text: StuyHacks IV is a 24-hour hackathon run by high school students and for high school students!
hackathon-eligibility: Participants must be high school students or middle school student in teams of two to four participants. Projects must also be original, and have been worked on only during the duration of this hackathon (with the exception of publically available code, APIs, and things of the like).
hackathon-rules:
Code of Conduct:
I agree to be civil, kind, and respectful to my fellow hackers, mentors, organizers, and everyone at StuyHacks, with the understanding that I may be asked to leave.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: This award will be given to the team whose project is the most effective display of technical complexity, originality and sheer awesomeness.
This award will be given to the team whose project is a strong display of technical complexity, originality and sheer awesomeness.
This award will be given to the team whose project is a strong display of technical complexity, originality and sheer awesomeness.
This award will be given to the team whose project is a creative, innovative and technically complex mobile application for either Android or iOS.
This award will be given to the team whose members are new to programming and have developed a creative and technically complex project.
This award will be given to the team that most effectively utilizes to hardware to develop a technically complex and innovative project. The hardware must be a major component of the project.
This award will be given to the team that most effectively develops a truly original and technically complex project.
This award will be given to the team that most effectively develops an innovative and technically complex game, for mobile and/or PC.
This award will be given to the team that completes all the problems of the CTF correctly in the fastest time.
Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment.
This award will be given to the team that hosts their project on a website from Domain.com with the coolest name.
